Class Board

java.lang.Object
board.Board
public class Board extends Object
The Board is made up of a 2D array of squares. It handles initial game setup, piece movement, movement validation (not notation validation), and check(mate) checks.

  • Method Details

    • getSquares

      public Square[][] getSquares()

    • movePiece

      public boolean movePiece(Square from, Square to, boolean color)
      movePiece is the core of the program's logic. It receives and processes movement orders
      Parameters:
      from - The original square of the piece to move
      to - The destination square of the piece to move
      color - The color of the current player, used for move validation
      Returns:
      A boolean value returned to callers. True indicates a successful move, false one that has failed and either never happened or was rolled back

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard()
      Prints the state of the board to the console after each move

    • placeBlack

      public void placeBlack()
      Initializes black's pieces at game start

    • placeWhite

      public void placeWhite()
      Initializes white's pieces at game start

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove(Square from, Square to, boolean color)
      Move validation logic. Specifically, this function confirms that the origin square has a piece of the current player's color and that the desired move is legal for that kind of piece.
      Parameters:
      from - The original square of the piece to move
      to - The destination square of the piece to move
      color - The color of the current player, used for move validation
      Returns:
      A boolean value returned to callers. Returns true for valid moves. Returns false and prints an explanation for invalid moves.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - for invalid moves.

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(boolean targetKingColor)
      A brief check for if a particular king is in check.
      Parameters:
      targetKingColor - determines which king is being checked for check
      Returns:
      Boolean value, true if check check finds the king in check, false otherwise

    • isCheckmate

      public boolean isCheckmate(boolean color)
      Function intended to check if king in check is also in checkmate. Checkmate check function not fully functional Intended function functionality is to check each possible piece for a side in check to see if any possible move results in a non-check state. Currently implemented only for the king, and breaks turn flow by having the king execute the first possible move to get out of check then asks his side for another move
      Parameters:
      color - The color of the king being checkmate checked
      Returns:
      Boolean value. True if check king is checkmated, false if normal check

    • kingSearch

      public Square kingSearch(boolean color)
      Helper function to find the square holding the king of a particular color
      Parameters:
      color -
      Returns:
      The square holding the desired king. If no king was found, prints an error message and returns an out-of-bounds square (which would break things if an AWOL king didn't already do that)

    • checkCheck

      public boolean checkCheck(Square s, Square k)
      Checks if the square holds a piece that can place an opposing king in check If there is a piece, checks the legal move list of that piece to see if any of them contain the location of the opposing king
      Parameters:
      s - The current square being checked
      k - The current location of the opposing king
      Returns:
      Boolean value. If true, enemy king is currently in check from this square.
